notes.text:
Red Hat AMQ Broker 7.11.0 is now available from the Red Hat Customer Portal.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
AMQ Broker is a high-performance messaging implementation based on ActiveMQ Artemis. It uses an asynchronous journal for fast message persistence, and supports multiple languages, protocols, and platforms.

This release of Red Hat AMQ Broker 7.11.0 includes security and bug fixes, and enhancements. For further information, refer to the release notes linked to in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* keycloak: path traversal via double URL encoding (CVE-2022-3782)

* springframework: DoS via data binding to multipartFile or servlet part (CVE-2022-22970)

* springframework: DoS with STOMP over WebSocket (CVE-2022-22971)

* WildFly: possible information disclosure (CVE-2022-1278)

* jetty-http: improver hostname input handling (CVE-2022-2047)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat AMQ Broker 7.11.0 release and security update

cwe.name: Initialization of a Resource with an Insecure Default

notes.text: A flaw was found in WildFly. This flaw allows an attacker to see deployment names, endpoints, and any other data the trace payload may contain.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: WildFly: possible information disclosure
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

notes.text: A flaw was found in Eclipse Jetty. When parsing the authority segment of an HTTP scheme URI, the Jetty HttpURI class improperly detects an invalid input as a hostname. This issue can lead to failures in a Proxy scenario.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jetty-http: improver hostname input handling
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In Red Hat Satellite jetty was used to build index files to search documentation. Nowadays in Satellite 6.9 and 6.10 jetty dependency is not in use and there is no access to it, so there is no way this vulnerability can be exploitable. Therefore Satellite supported versions are not affected.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Keycloak, where it does not properly validate URLs included in a redirect. An attacker can use this flaw to construct a malicious request to bypass validation and access other URLs and potentially sensitive information within the domain or possibly conduct further attacks. This flaw affects any client that utilizes a wildcard in the Valid Redirect URIs field.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: keycloak: path traversal via double URL encoding
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Build of Quarkus is not impacted as this CVE affects the server-side Keycloak execution but Quarkus only acts as a Keycloak client in its quarkus-keycloak-authorization extension. For this reason Quarkus is marked with Low impact.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A flaw was found in Spring Framework. Applications that handle file uploads are vulnerable to a denial of service (DoS) attack if they rely on data binding to set a MultipartFile or javax.servlet.Part to a field in a model object.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: springframework: DoS via data binding to multipartFile or servlet part

notes.text: A flaw was found in Spring Framework Applications. Applications that use STOMP over the WebSocket endpoint are vulnerable to a denial of service attack caused by an authenticated user.
